channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned rubbish/ fly tipping on pavement, 8th July
item.description:
The rubbish has been here on the pavement near 1 Tremaine Road for over two weeks and more items are being added to the pile week on week. Please can someone remove?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tremaine Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees causing obstruction, 8th July
item.description:
The overhang creates a dark tunnel, which blocks visibility which has implications for personal safety, as well as creating a physical obstruction. This is one of the main access routes on/off the Millpond Estate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39-54, Paradise Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish & old fridge, 8th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Walk, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Mix of commercial and domestic waste fly tipping, 8th July
item.description:
Overnight a significant amount of household and industrial rubbish in rubbish bags has been dumped on the pavement and opened. Waste including paint cans and carpet can be seen along with electrical items.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped black pet cage, 8th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burford Road, Southborough, London

item.title: Damaged tree dangerously hanging over the road hitting vehicles, 8th July
item.description:
Tree looks like it has been damaged and has a large section hanging down over the highway hitting vehicles and causing vehicles to swerve - very dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Logs Hill, Elmstead, London

item.title: Loose Manhole Cover, 8th July
item.description:
This manhole cover is loose. It’s in the bus lane so when the bus (and other vehicles) drives over it it makes an almighty double bang. This goes on throughout the night so not ideal for adjacent residents especially in the hot weather as windows are open. I imagine there is a safety issue as well.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 170, Camberwell Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
